definition: preliminary exam/qualifying exam/first try/preliminary testing
at first/(at the) beginning/first/junior/basic
to test/to try/experiment/examination/test
to have a try/to try one's hand/initial foray

sentences.english: She sang her first solos in church.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在教堂第一次初试啼声。

sentences.english: Obviously, it was their first time to Hatsune, or even first time to try Japanese restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 很明显初来隐泉，而且可能是初试日本料理。

sentences.english: This young star made his debut in a Disney movie.
sentences.chinese: 这位年轻的明星是在迪士尼的电影中初试啼声的。

sentences.english: I was present in one of the sections when young Scoresby underwent his preliminary examination .
sentences.chinese: 年轻的斯考兹比参加初试时，我在他那个小组。

sentences.english: The preliminary results of using Trichogramma to control Heliothis armigera had been reported.
sentences.chinese: 报道了利用赤眼蜂防治棉铃虫的初试结果。

definition: to sit for the second round of a two-stage exam
written examination/paper test (for an applicant)
entrance examination
to be interviewed (as a candidate)/interview
unified examination (e.g. across the country)
oral examination/oral test
to add material to an exam/supplementary exam
to enter oneself for an examination
to accept an applicant (prospective student, employee etc) who passes an entrance exam/to admit (a student)/to hire (a job candidate)
exam candidate/student whose name has been put forward for an exam
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
to take an exam/exam/CL:次[ci4]
to investigate/to inspect and study
to advertise an entrance examination for an academic institution (old)
to sit an entrance exam for a graduate program
horizontal line (in a fraction)/minimum passing score
